main_definition: A pixel is the smallest controllable element of a picture represented on a screen.

meanings_and_examples.example: The resolution of my monitor is 1920x1080 pixels.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Element in a digital image or graphic
meanings_and_examples.example: Each pixel contributes to the overall color and shape of an image.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unit of measure for screen resolution
meanings_and_examples.example: A higher number of pixels generally means better image quality on screens.
Digital cameras capture images as a matrix of pixel values.
